item.title: Fallen tree remnants, 26th December
item.description:

item.title: The two horizontal tree trunks that stop travellers entering the Heath have been moved by abandoned vehicle,, 26th December
item.description:
The gap that has been left by the moving of tree trunks is now wide enough for vehicles & caravans to enter the heath. I can remember the last time travellers arrived at Bostall heath & it took weeks to get them removed, there is also an abandoned car near the opening which I presume moved the trees. As a concerned local resident & dog Walker I thought I should report this as it has been like this for over a week.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Longleigh Lane, Bexleyheath
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mattress, bed and cardboard box, 26th December
item.description:

item.title: Two Shopping trolleys dumped, 26th December
item.description:
Just inside the entrance to Rowanwood Ave off Burnt Oak Lane. Two shopping trolleys, two traffic cones, road sign and garden chair. Were all strewn across the pavement. Have now been moved to the side to clear the pavement. First noticed morning of 26th Dec.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Marrabon Close, Blackfen, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Council Property Graffiti, 26th December
item.description:
Discovered just now. Bethesda Court 123 Maple Road SE20 8LP Graffiti on external entry glass door & window to block. Must have happened between 2AM today & all morning. Photo taken from inside property. Says 'OOPS' - seen exact same design on Elmer's End store front last year December. Landlord is Riverside.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 115, Maple Road, Anerley, City of London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 37/39 Lorrimore Rd SE17, 26th December
item.description:
Walking home last night with my nephew my foot went straight down this access cover on the pavement. The cover flipped and my shoe ended up falling off and down the hole. I have a bruised shin bone and my left kneecap took a big hit as well. Lucky not to have broken my leg.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lorrimore Road, Walworth, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
